clusters.title: What to know about Ukraine's push for security guarantees in any peace deal with Russia
clusters.neutral_headline: Discussions Continue Regarding Ukraine Peace Deal with Russia

items.title: What to know about Ukraine's push for security guarantees in any peace deal with Russia
items.standfirst: The Trump administration is pushing for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin to meet as part of efforts to end the war between their countries. But amid Trump's recent meetings with both leaders, Russia has continued to strike Ukraine. CBS News' Holly Williams reports from Kyiv.
items.content: The Trump administration is pushing for Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin to meet as part of efforts to end the war between their countries. But amid Trump's recent meetings with both leaders, Russia has continued to strike Ukraine. CBS News' Holly Williams reports from Kyiv.

items.title: Trump and Zelenskyy's meeting with European leaders marks a historic moment
items.standfirst: European leaders joined Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington on Monday in a rare display of unity to end the war with Russia.
items.content: European leaders joined Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington on Monday in a rare display of unity to end the war with Russia.

items.title: Some in Congress expressing cautious optimism for possible Ukraine-Russia peace deal
items.standfirst: Some congressional leaders are expressing cautious optimism about a possible deal to end Russia's war with Ukraine following President Trump's recent meetings with Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.
items.content: Some congressional leaders are expressing cautious optimism about a possible deal to end Russia's war with Ukraine following President Trump's recent meetings with Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.

items.title: Unclear what U.S. involvement in Ukrainian security guarantees would entail
items.standfirst: In the 24 hours since President Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders, more questions than answers have emerged. While negotiations for peace have increased, the relentless bombing has raged on. CBS News' Nancy Cordes reports on the latest. Seth G. Jones, the president of the Defense and Security Department at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins "The Takeout" with analysis.
items.content: In the 24 hours since President Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders, more questions than answers have emerged. While negotiations for peace have increased, the relentless bombing has raged on. CBS News' Nancy Cordes reports on the latest. Seth G. Jones, the president of the Defense and Security Department at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins "The Takeout" with analysis.

items.title: President Trump’s Talks with the Leaders of Russia and Ukraine
items.standfirst: President Trump, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and seven European leaders met at the White House to talk about ending the war between Russia and Ukraine. The meeting followed a summit between Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska last week. We dive into the proposals to end the war and how each side might react to them. We hear from NPR’s correspondent in Moscow and Ukraine’s former foreign minister.
items.content: President Trump, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and seven European leaders met at the White House to talk about ending the war between Russia and Ukraine. The meeting followed a summit between Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska last week. We dive into the proposals to end the war and how each side might react to them. We hear from NPR’s correspondent in Moscow and Ukraine’s former foreign minister.(Image credit: Alex Brandon)

items.title: The future of Donbas at stake in Ukraine negotiations
items.standfirst: Our colleagues at France 2 report from the Donbas. Russian President Vladimir Putin made it clear in his meeting with US President Donald Trump in Alaska last week: full control of this strategic, symbolic territory is his condition to end the war.
items.content: Our colleagues at France 2 report from the Donbas. Russian President Vladimir Putin made it clear in his meeting with US President Donald Trump in Alaska last week: full control of this strategic, symbolic territory is his condition to end the war.

items.title: Suited and full of praise, Ukraine and allies woo Trump away from Putin
items.standfirst: While the Kremlin smarted, a sense of relief swept through Ukraine and across Europe after Zelenskyy's summit with President Trump.
items.content: While the Kremlin smarted, a sense of relief swept through Ukraine and across Europe after Zelenskyy's summit with President Trump.

items.title: Watch: Two presidents, two very different Oval Office encounters
items.standfirst: Onlookers gasped as Trump and Zelensky's meeting in Washington in February descended into chaos, but times have changed.
items.content: Onlookers gasped as Trump and Zelensky's meeting in Washington in February descended into chaos, but times have changed.

items.title: Watch: Zelensky's 'fabulous' suit and other moments from Trump meeting
items.standfirst: Ukraine's president and other European leaders met at the White House to talk peace.
items.content: Ukraine's president and other European leaders met at the White House to talk peace.

items.title: France's Macron says he doesn't believe Putin is 'very willing to get peace' in Ukraine
items.standfirst: There must be a push for peace to end the war between Russia and Ukraine, but French President Emmanuel Macron is skeptical that Russian President Vladimir Putin is ready to resolve the conflict.
items.content: There must be a push for peace to end the war between Russia and Ukraine, but French President Emmanuel Macron is skeptical that Russian President Vladimir Putin is ready to resolve the conflict.

items.title: Four key takeaways from Ukraine talks in Washington
items.standfirst: Ukraine's President Zelensky managed to avoid another disastrous Oval Office meeting with Donald Trump.
items.content: Ukraine's President Zelensky managed to avoid another disastrous Oval Office meeting with Donald Trump.

items.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, European leaders meet at White House
items.standfirst: President Trump and Ukraine’s President Zelenskyy held a White House meeting that was much warmer in tone then their showdown a few months ago. Trump said there does not need to be a ceasefire to move forward with a peace deal, while suggesting he would support security guarantees for Ukraine. NBC Nightly News anchor Tom Llamas reports.
items.content: President Trump and Ukraine’s President Zelenskyy held a White House meeting that was much warmer in tone then their showdown a few months ago. Trump said there does not need to be a ceasefire to move forward with a peace deal, while suggesting he would support security guarantees for Ukraine. NBC Nightly News anchor Tom Llamas reports.

items.title: What is Ukraine's Donbas region, and why is it so important in Trump talks?
items.standfirst: The Donbas region of eastern Ukraine will be crucial to President Trump's talks with Zelenskyy and European leaders after his summit with Russia's Vladimir Putin. What is the Donbas and where is it?
items.content: The Donbas region of eastern Ukraine will be crucial to President Trump's talks with Zelenskyy and European leaders after his summit with Russia's Vladimir Putin. What is the Donbas and where is it?

items.title: Ukraine brings reinforcements to Trump meeting, hoping to avoid another White House fiasco
items.standfirst: European leaders will support Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday as President Trump fueled new alarm among Ukraine's allies after his summit with Vladimir Putin.
items.content: European leaders will support Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday as President Trump fueled new alarm among Ukraine's allies after his summit with Vladimir Putin.

items.title: Trump to plan sit-down meeting with Zelenskyy and Putin
items.standfirst: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with President Donald Trump at the White House, just days after Trump and Russia’s President Vladimir Putin left an Alaska summit without a ceasefire deal.
items.content: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy meets with President Donald Trump at the White House, just days after Trump and Russia’s President Vladimir Putin left an Alaska summit without a ceasefire deal.

ai_summary: President Trump met with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and European leaders recently.
Russia continues striking Ukraine despite ongoing peace negotiations.
Some in Congress express cautious optimism about a possible peace deal.
The U.S. involvement in Ukrainian security guarantees remains unclear.
Proposals to end the war and reactions from each side are being discussed.

clusters.title: Hurricane Erin threatens East Coast with dangerous rip currents
clusters.neutral_headline: Hurricane Erin Threatens East Coast with Dangerous Conditions

items.title: Hurricane Erin threatens East Coast with dangerous rip currents
items.standfirst: Meteorologists are closely tracking the projected path and forecast of Hurricane Erin, which is the first hurricane to develop over the Atlantic this year.
items.content: Meteorologists are closely tracking the projected path and forecast of Hurricane Erin, which is the first hurricane to develop over the Atlantic this year.

items.title: Hurricane Erin leaves some US East Coast beaches off limits

items.content: The category two storm threatens to bring life-threatening surf and rip currents to the region.

items.title: Hurricane Erin forces Outer Banks evacuations, East Coast beach closures
items.standfirst: Hurricane Erin is forcing evacuations on North Carolina's Outer Banks as it threatens to whip up wild waves, rip currents and tropical-force winds.
items.content: Hurricane Erin is forcing evacuations on North Carolina's Outer Banks as it threatens to whip up wild waves, rip currents and tropical-force winds.

items.title: Hurricane Erin takes aim at eastern US coast, threatens major storm surge
items.standfirst: Hurricane Erin churned slowly toward the eastern US coast Tuesday, generating dangerous surf and rip currents that prompted dozens of rescues. While forecast to remain offshore, its outer bands threaten tropical-storm-force winds and life-threatening swells.
items.content: Hurricane Erin churned slowly toward the eastern US coast Tuesday, generating dangerous surf and rip currents that prompted dozens of rescues. While forecast to remain offshore, its outer bands threaten tropical-storm-force winds and life-threatening swells.

items.title: Hurricane Erin update: Storm set to bring large waves and flooding to US
items.standfirst: Forecasts nudge Erin's likely path to the west, increasing the risks at U.S. beaches. Tropical storm conditions are expected in North Carolina's Outer Banks starting late Wednesday.
items.content: Forecasts nudge Erin's likely path to the west, increasing the risks at U.S. beaches. Tropical storm conditions are expected in North Carolina's Outer Banks starting late Wednesday.(Image credit: Pablo Martinez Monsivais)

items.title: Walmart recalls frozen shrimp over potential radioactive contamination
items.standfirst: Walmart recalls frozen shrimp over potential radioactive contamination Walmart has recalled frozen, raw shrimp sold in 13 states because federal health officials say it could have potential radioactive contamination. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration asked Walmart to pull three lots of Great…
items.content: Walmart recalls frozen shrimp over potential radioactive contamination Walmart has recalled frozen, raw shrimp sold in 13 states because federal health officials say it could have potential radioactive contamination. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration asked Walmart to pull three lots of Great…

items.title: Walmart recalls frozen shrimp over potential radioactive contamination
items.standfirst: The risk from the recalled shrimp is "quite low," said Donald Schaffner, a food safety expert at Rutgers University. Cesium-137 is a byproduct of nuclear reactions.
items.content: The risk from the recalled shrimp is "quite low," said Donald Schaffner, a food safety expert at Rutgers University. Cesium-137 is a byproduct of nuclear reactions. (Image credit: Charles Krupa)

The FDA said that a radioactive isotope, cesium-137,…
items.content: The US Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday urged the public not to eat certain bags of frozen raw shrimp sold at Walmart, citing concerns about unsanitary conditions and radioactive contamination found in shipments from the same supplier. The FDA said that a radioactive isotope, cesium-137,…

items.title: Walmart recalls Great Value shrimp after FDA warns of radioactive risk

items.content: Some packages of Great Value frozen shrimp sold at Walmart are at risk for potential for Cesium-137 contamination, the FDA says.

ai_summary: Walmart is recalling frozen shrimp sold in thirteen states.

Cesium-137, a byproduct of nuclear reactions, is the contaminant.
The risk from the recalled shrimp is considered quite low.

clusters.title: Trump’s White House takes to TikTok as deadline looms to ban platform
clusters.neutral_headline: White House Launches TikTok Account Amidst Ban Deadline

items.title: Trump’s White House takes to TikTok as deadline looms to ban platform
items.standfirst: The new account comes as Trump has three times delayed implementing a 'sell or ban' law for the Chinese-owned app.
items.content: The new account comes as Trump has three times delayed implementing a 'sell or ban' law for the Chinese-owned app.

items.title: White House launches official TikTok account after Trump vowed ban in 2020
items.standfirst: US president was concerned over app’s Chinese ownership, but has softened after believing it won him 2024 electionThe White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, as Donald Trump continues to permit the Chinese-owned platform to operate in the US despite a law requiring its sale.“America we are BACK! What’s up TikTok?” read a caption on the account’s first post, a 27-second clip, on the popular video-sharing app. Continue reading...
items.content: US president was concerned over app’s Chinese ownership, but has softened after believing it won him 2024 electionThe White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, as Donald Trump continues to permit the Chinese-owned platform to operate in the US despite a law requiring its sale.“America we are BACK! What’s up TikTok?” read a caption on the account’s first post, a 27-second clip, on the popular video-sharing app. Continue reading...

items.title: White House launches official TikTok account as Trump's deadline to ban app looms
items.standfirst: The White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, less than a month before a Sept. 17 deadline for the app to either find a new owner or face a U.S.-wide ban.
items.content: The White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday, less than a month before a Sept. 17 deadline for the app to either find a new owner or face a U.S.-wide ban.

items.title: White House Launches TikTok Account With US Sale Uncertain
items.standfirst: The White House launched its own TikTok account on Tuesday, the latest signal of support as President Donald Trump continues to seek a sale of the social video app’s US operations from Chinese company ByteDance Ltd.
items.content: The White House launched its own TikTok account on Tuesday, the latest signal of support as President Donald Trump continues to seek a sale of the social video app’s US operations from Chinese company ByteDance Ltd.

ai_summary: The White House launched an official TikTok account on Tuesday.
The launch comes before a September 17 deadline for the app.

President Trump continues to seek a sale of the app's US operations.

clusters.title: Mo Salah wins record third PFA Player of the Year award
clusters.neutral_headline: Mo Salah Wins Record Third PFA Player of the Year Award

items.title: Mo Salah wins record third PFA Player of the Year award
items.standfirst: The Liverpool star is the first three-time winner of the annual award, given to the best player in English football.
items.content: The Liverpool star is the first three-time winner of the annual award, given to the best player in English football.

items.title: Liverpool's Salah makes history as first three-time PFA player of the year winner
items.standfirst: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah became the first player to win the Professional Footballers’ Association men’s player of the year award three times on Tuesday, after scoring 29 goals and 18 assists to seal the club’s 20th league title last season. The Egyptian also won in 2018 and 2022.
items.content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah became the first player to win the Professional Footballers’ Association men’s player of the year award three times on Tuesday, after scoring 29 goals and 18 assists to seal the club’s 20th league title last season. The Egyptian also won in 2018 and 2022.

items.title: 'The hunger makes me want more' - Salah wins third PFA award
items.standfirst: Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah says it is "something I'll never forget and take for granted" after becoming the first player to receive three PFA Player of the Year awards.
items.content: Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah says it is "something I'll never forget and take for granted" after becoming the first player to receive three PFA Player of the Year awards.

items.title: Salah and Rogers scoop PFA player of the year awards
items.standfirst: Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah wins the Professional Footballers' Association men's player of the year award, with Aston Villa midfielder Morgan Rogers named young player of the year.
items.content: Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah wins the Professional Footballers' Association men's player of the year award, with Aston Villa midfielder Morgan Rogers named young player of the year.

items.title: Caldentey and Smith win PFA player of the year awards
items.standfirst: Arsenal midfielder Mariona Caldentey is named the Professional Footballers' Association women's player of the year as her new team-mate Olivia Smith wins the young player award.
items.content: Arsenal midfielder Mariona Caldentey is named the Professional Footballers' Association women's player of the year as her new team-mate Olivia Smith wins the young player award.

ai_summary: Mohamed Salah won the PFA Player of the Year award for the third time.
Salah is the first player to win the award three times.
He scored 29 goals and 18 assists last season.
Morgan Rogers was named Young Player of the Year.
Mariona Caldentey and Olivia Smith also won PFA awards.

items.title: Shower gel ad gets UK ban for suggesting black skin is problematic

items.content: The TV ad depicted two black models with skin problems and a white model without.

The ad suggested black skin is problematic.

A white model in the ad had no skin problems.

items.title: Israel demands release of all Gaza hostages, casting doubt on ceasefire proposal
items.standfirst: It comes a day after Hamas said it accepted a proposal for a 60-day truce, during which around half of the 50 hostages would be freed.
items.content: It comes a day after Hamas said it accepted a proposal for a 60-day truce, during which around half of the 50 hostages would be freed.

items.content: There was a muted response from Israel after Hamas said it had agreed to the latest proposal for a ceasefire in Gaza and to free the remaining hostages.

items.title: Gaza ceasefire proposal agreed by Hamas 'almost identical' to US special envoy's, Qatar says
items.standfirst: A latest Gaza ceasefire proposal approved by Hamas is "almost identical" to that put forward by US special envoy Steve Witkoff, a spokesperson for Qatar's foreign ministry has said.
items.content: A latest Gaza ceasefire proposal approved by Hamas is "almost identical" to that put forward by US special envoy Steve Witkoff, a spokesperson for Qatar's foreign ministry has said.

clusters.title: Air Canada flights slowly resume after flight attendants agree to end their strike
clusters.neutral_headline: Air Canada Flight Attendants End Strike with New Deal

items.title: Air Canada flights slowly resume after flight attendants agree to end their strike
items.standfirst: The flight attendants' union said a new agreement guarantees members will be paid for work performed while planes are on the ground, resolving one of the major issues that drove the strike.
items.content: The flight attendants' union said a new agreement guarantees members will be paid for work performed while planes are on the ground, resolving one of the major issues that drove the strike.(Image credit: Christinne Muschi)

items.title: Air Canada flight attendants reach ‘tentative’ deal with airline to end strike
items.standfirst: Strike over wages and ground work has cancelled travel for 500,000 people worldwideAir Canada flight attendants say they have reached a “tentative” deal with the airline to end a strike over wages and ground work that has cancelled travel for half a million people worldwide.Roughly 10,000 flight attendants walked off the job after midnight Saturday, insisting Air Canada had failed to address their demands for higher pay and compensation for unpaid ground work, including during boarding. Continue reading...
items.content: Strike over wages and ground work has cancelled travel for 500,000 people worldwideAir Canada flight attendants say they have reached a “tentative” deal with the airline to end a strike over wages and ground work that has cancelled travel for half a million people worldwide.Roughly 10,000 flight attendants walked off the job after midnight Saturday, insisting Air Canada had failed to address their demands for higher pay and compensation for unpaid ground work, including during boarding. Continue reading...

items.title: Air Canada and flight attendants reach tentative deal to end strike
items.standfirst: The Air Canada strike has ended after flight attendants reached a tentative agreement with the airline, both parties said early Tuesday."The Strike has ended," the Canadian Union of Public Employees said in a Facebook post advising its membership to "fully cooperate with resumption of operations."
items.content: The Air Canada strike has ended after flight attendants reached a tentative agreement with the airline, both parties said early Tuesday."The Strike has ended," the Canadian Union of Public Employees said in a Facebook post advising its membership to "fully cooperate with resumption of operations."

ai_summary: Air Canada flight attendants reached a tentative deal with the airline.
The strike was over wages and ground work.
The new agreement guarantees pay for ground work.
The strike had canceled travel for many people.
The Canadian Union of Public Employees announced the end.

clusters.title: Scores die in bus crash carrying Afghan migrants returning home
clusters.neutral_headline: Bus Crash in Afghanistan Kills Returning Migrants

items.title: Scores die in bus crash carrying Afghan migrants returning home
items.standfirst: A collision between a bus and two other vehicles killed at least 76 people in western Afghanistan, local officials said on Wednesday. The bus was carrying Afghan migrants who had been living in Iran and were returning home to Kabul.
items.content: A collision between a bus and two other vehicles killed at least 76 people in western Afghanistan, local officials said on Wednesday. The bus was carrying Afghan migrants who had been living in Iran and were returning home to Kabul.

items.title: Bus crash kills dozens of migrants just deported back to Afghanistan by Iran
items.standfirst: Seventy-six people were killed in a collision between a bus carrying Afghan migrants just deported by Iran and two other vehicles in western Afghanistan, a provincial official said Wednesday.
items.content: Seventy-six people were killed in a collision between a bus carrying Afghan migrants just deported by Iran and two other vehicles in western Afghanistan, a provincial official said Wednesday.

ai_summary: A bus crash killed dozens of Afghan migrants.
The migrants were returning from Iran.
The crash involved a bus and two other vehicles.
Seventy-six people died in the collision.
The crash occurred in western Afghanistan.

clusters.title: Trump’s tariffs replace diplomacy as other US tools of statecraft are discarded
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump's Tariffs Replace Diplomacy in Trade Policy

items.title: Trump’s tariffs replace diplomacy as other US tools of statecraft are discarded
items.standfirst: Measures meant to rebalance America’s economy are wielded instead against the likes of Canada, India and Brazil ‘to compel loyalty to the president’ On the campaign trail, Donald Trump pledged to use tariffs to revitalise American industry, bringing jobs home and helping to make America great…
items.content: Measures meant to rebalance America’s economy are wielded instead against the likes of Canada, India and Brazil ‘to compel loyalty to the president’ On the campaign trail, Donald Trump pledged to use tariffs to revitalise American industry, bringing jobs home and helping to make America great…

items.title: Trump’s tariffs replace diplomacy as other US tools of statecraft are discarded
items.standfirst: Measures meant to rebalance America’s economy are wielded instead against the likes of Canada, India and Brazil ‘to compel loyalty to the president’On the campaign trail, Donald Trump pledged to use tariffs to revitalise American industry, bringing jobs home and helping to make America great again. But more than six months into his administration, experts say the president’s trade war is increasingly being wielded as a political cudgel, in lieu of more traditional forms of diplomacy.The president’s current target, India, has been unable to reach a trade agreement, and Trump appears ready to follow through with his threat to impose a further 25% tariff on Delhi – bringing the total to 50% – the joint highest levy on any country, along with Brazil. Continue reading...
items.content: Measures meant to rebalance America’s economy are wielded instead against the likes of Canada, India and Brazil ‘to compel loyalty to the president’On the campaign trail, Donald Trump pledged to use tariffs to revitalise American industry, bringing jobs home and helping to make America great again. But more than six months into his administration, experts say the president’s trade war is increasingly being wielded as a political cudgel, in lieu of more traditional forms of diplomacy.The president’s current target, India, has been unable to reach a trade agreement, and Trump appears ready to follow through with his threat to impose a further 25% tariff on Delhi – bringing the total to 50% – the joint highest levy on any country, along with Brazil. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Trump used tariffs instead of diplomacy.
Tariffs were used against Canada, India, and Brazil.
The goal was to compel loyalty to the president.
Experts say tariffs are a political tool.
India faces a potential 50% tariff.

clusters.title: Kylian Mbappé leads Real Madrid to La Liga season opener win against Osasuna
clusters.neutral_headline: Mbappe Scores as Real Madrid Wins La Liga Opener

items.title: Kylian Mbappé leads Real Madrid to La Liga season opener win against Osasuna
items.standfirst: Real Madrid was far from perfect in their first appearance of the season, but the 15-time European champions only needed one goal to beat Osasuna. And who else to provide it other than Kylian Mbappé, whose penalty was enough to secure the win – the first in La Liga for Xabi Alonso as Real Madrid head coach.
items.content: Real Madrid was far from perfect in their first appearance of the season, but the 15-time European champions only needed one goal to beat Osasuna. clusters.title: Texas Democrats tear ‘permission slips’ imposed by Republican house speaker

items.title: Texas Democrats tear ‘permission slips’ imposed by Republican house speaker
items.standfirst: Lawmakers refuse to vacate house chamber to protest surveillance after they left state over GOP attempt to redraw mapsTexas Democrats are tearing up “permission slips” they signed in order to leave the chamber, joining state representative Nicole Collier ahead of Wednesday’s vote on the controversial Texas congressional redistricting maps.The slips are part of new surveillance protocols set by Texas Republicans in the house chamber, stating that Democrats would “be granted written permission to leave only after agreeing to be released into the custody of a designated [Texas department of public safety] officer” who would ensure their return to the chamber. Continue reading...

items.title: Texas Rep. Nicole Collier speaks out after being told she can't leave Capitol without police escort
items.standfirst: The Texas House of Representatives is expected to vote Wednesday on a Republican-proposed redistricting map after Democratic lawmakers returned to the state this week. One lawmaker, State Rep. Nicole Collier, has been at the Texas Capitol since Monday after refusing a mandatory police escort meant to ensure Democrats will show up when the state House convenes Wednesday. She joins "The Takeout" to discuss.
